em.strong: In response to the COVID-19 situation, Grantham Village School campus is CLOSED to students, families, and visitors and will be closed for the rest of the school year. For further information, please see below and check this site frequently for new information.

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-uQSCkd jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc
hJDwNd-AhqUyc-uQSCkd jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc

div.jsaction: click:cOuCgd; mousedown:UX7yZ; mouseup:lbsD7e; mouseenter:tfO1Yc; mouseleave:JywGue; focus:AHmuwe; blur:O22p3e; contextmenu:mg9Pef;

div.p: Our team at GVS has reviewed state and federal guidance on the issue of remote learning, and we’ve combined this information with what we’ve experienced and learned with you over the past few weeks in our new world of school. All of this information has resulted in the following guidelines for remote learning at GVS. More than anything, we recognize that each family may have different needs, and we’ll do whatever we can to be flexible and adaptive to those needs.
We’re in this together; we’re a team of great, collaborative problem solvers and we’re committed to working with you the whole way through.

p.a: Click here for our whole guidance document.

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-uQSCkd jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc

p.em: Over the next few weeks, our superintendent, Sydney Leggett, will be hosting several webinars online that are available to all parents and guardians in our community to update everyone on COVID-19 planning. If you're interested in participating in any of these, please prepare by downloading Zoom on your computer or phone (you may also download the client at the time of the meeting). There is no cost for the Zoom program. Participating in these webinars is not required and the District will continue to get messages out in all the usual ways, but this online method will enable everyone to get information at the same time, adding the ability to write in questions that are likely shared by many. Thank you.

h3.div: Please watch this space for updates and links to the webinars

Video recording of the meeting - click here.

strong.a: Official School District March 10, 2020 Election Results

div.small: The Grantham School District is looking for a few community volunteers to help develop a revision to our non-discrimination policy. This is an opportunity to help devise a plan to proactively prevent, recognize and approach discrimination based on age, sex, race, creed, color, marital status, physical or mental disability, national origin, sexual orientation, or gender identify. We value community input and would love to have more voices in this group. If interested, please contact Sydney Leggett at the SAU 75 office at 863-9689 or via email at sleggett@sau75.org.

The GVS Integrated Preschool serves Grantham residents ages 3-5 with special needs, as well as their typical peers. If you are a Grantham resident and your child will be 3 or 4 years old on or before September 30, 2020, please complete a preschool registration form. Please return the completed form by March 13th to Grantham Village School via fax 603-863-8377; email: ntilton@gvshawks.org or call us at 603-863-1681. Preschool screenings will take place by appointment only on March 20th.
Please click on the following documents to view:
Student Liaison to the Grantham School Board application. Application deadline: February 24, 2020.

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-uQSCkd jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc

p.em: Welcome to Grantham Village School! In partnership with the people of Grantham, our mission is to provide excellence in education. Together we mentor our students to become critical thinkers, creative learners and independent problem solvers. We aspire to nurture in each student a lifelong love of learning. As competent, responsible, and caring citizens, our students will know and apply the skills necessary to make positive contributions within a diverse global society.
